lines.text:
[showing off her bedroom]
Here it is.
Lady, when you say, "I do take thee," how you take him.
[chuckles]
Got this all to yourself?
Yep, all to myself.
Always all to yourself?
Yep.
Well, a whole lot of us do a whole lot more for a whole lot less.
Feeling better?
Yes, thanks to you.
You're gonna find out about men - -the tripe.
No, thanks. Not interested.
Swell. They come to my dump to get taken, see? And if you're smart...
[to woman in subway]
Am I talking loud enough?
I'm kind of sick of men.
Oh, you're crazy. They've got what we want, all of it. And every gal has her price. Yours ought to be high.
[to woman on subway]
Every gal has her price. I don't know what got, but you sure gyped somebody.
What a break for us.
Tommy, look, corned beef hash and pouched egg, for 30 cents.
If you've lost your marriage certificate, don't worry, very broad minded, this landlady.
I'm Tommy Wallace. Not that that cuts any ice.
Oh, there's no ice around here. I got warm just listening to you.
Do you two girls want to get married?
Whoa! Whoopie! Ha-ha, I must be drunk.
Hey, you're a great girl, Sadie. Is your mother alive?
Yeah.

Oh, that's fine. I'll tell you what we'll do. We'll send her a little present, huh? Anything you like. We'll send her a season pass to the Yankee stadium, huh? Ha-ha, yes, yes, just a little present, just a little present.
[Passes out, drunk]
You get some sleep, so we can celebrate some more.
We'll celebrate all our lives. Nothing, but, celebrate.
Listen, are you going to be nuts about that canary all your life?
I do as I like because I like it.
Hey, what happened to those freckles?

[laughs]
I outgrew them, I guess.

[Looking her over]
You did a pretty good job of outgrowing a lot of things.

[Looking at Sadie's newspaper on the table]
Hey, what are you doing with these? Keeping track of Tommy?
Mmm hmm.
Listen, are you gonna be nuts about that canary all your life?
I'm afraid so.
Well, control yourself because you got everything. Everything!

[Talking to Tommy on the telephone]
Hello, Tommy.
Sadie, when I saw you this afternoon, my heart stopped.
Yes, I know. I felt the same way. Only that was this afternoon.
Sadie, I've known you a long while.
You used to like me, didn't you?
A lot. A whole lot. Why not go back to being a sweet girl?
Well, what do you want me to do?

[to Sadie]
You ran away with a no-good-for-nothing rat. Then because he let you down, you jumped at the same cheap conclusions all cheap people do.

[to Dolly]
Instead of thanking you, I could kill you and love it.
I do as I like because I like it. But I never sold myself for money.
Shut up!
[Sadie pushes Dolly, who falls backward into a trunk, her legs flying in the air]

[Lying in a hospital bed]
I never stopped being crazy about you.
I know that.
I've been lying here thinking about you every second I'm awake.
Tommy...
Don't shut me up!
